meanings.definition: A substance that forms an emulsion.
meanings.sent1: The emulsoid helped mix the oil and water together smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The chef added the emulsoid to create a creamy salad dressing.
meanings.sent3: The emulsoid decided to throw a party and invited oil and water to mix things up.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an emulsoid, blending joy and warmth seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The emulsoid acted as a mediator between the oil and water, bringing them together in harmony.

meanings.definition: Resembling an emulsion in properties or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The emulsoid texture of the lotion made it easy to spread on the skin.
meanings.sent2: The paint had an emulsoid quality, giving it a smooth and glossy finish.
meanings.sent3: The emulsoid clouds in the sky looked like fluffy pillows floating above.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had an emulsoid quality, blending sweetness and strength effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The emulsoid colors of the sunset painted the sky in a beautiful blend of hues.
